title: Sweet Potato Carbonara
directions: In a large skillet, melt butter over medium-high heat. Add garlic, cooking for 30-60 seconds until aromatic. Toss sweet potato ribbons and mushrooms into the pan. Saut√© until shiny and crisp-tender, about 3 minutes.

Whisk together half-and-half and cornstarch. Drizzle atop the veggies in the pan, stirring gently just until the sauce begins to thicken. Lower heat to medium, toss in spinach and bacon, and allow to cook just until the spinach begins to wilt.
Transfer to a serving bowl and season with salt and pepper to taste. Top with Parmesan.
ingredients: oz (about 2 cups) sweet potato ribbons or spirals
oz sliced baby bella (cremini) mushrooms SAVE $
slices cooked bacon, finely chopped SAVE $
